items.title: The Long Night — Washington Original
items.logline: A curated night stream that stitches together the most relevant films, series, and creator sessions for you.
items.synopsis: This immersive experience combines carefully selected content into a seamless viewing journey. Over the course of 2 hours and 8 minutes, viewers are taken on a curated path through multiple genres and formats, creating a unique late-night viewing experience.
items.fullPlot:
The Long Night is an experimental streaming format that reimagines how audiences consume content in the late-night hours. Rather than presenting a single linear narrative, this curated stream weaves together feature films, episodic content, and creator sessions into a cohesive thematic journey.

The experience begins with atmospheric establishing content, gradually building through character-driven shorts, documentary segments exploring the creative process, and culminating in a feature-length narrative that ties together the evening's themes. Throughout the 2-hour-8-minute runtime, viewers encounter work from emerging and established creators, all selected to create a seamless flow that respects the late-night viewing mindset.

This Washington Original represents a new approach to content curation, where the relationship between pieces matters as much as the individual works themselves. The Long Night demonstrates how streaming can evolve beyond the traditional VOD model into something more akin to curated exhibition, while maintaining the on-demand flexibility modern audiences expect.
items.creator: Autumn Shih

enablingSponsor.name: REDAVID HAIR
enablingSponsor.tagline: Their support helped bring this Washington Original to life. Supporting them helps us make more nights like this.

items.title: Mathmagical 'I'
items.logline: A young orphan discovers she can manipulate reality through mathematical equations, making her a target for a secret society that controls the world.
items.synopsis: Viola Dowden, an 11-year-old orphan with undiagnosed supernatural abilities, witnesses a magical battle on her street and inadvertently manifests fire during her first day at a new school. Her teacher Miss Garcias reveals that Viola is a rare 'Mathmagician' capable of wielding True Math to manipulate reality, making her a threat to The Ruler and his hidden society.
items.fullPlot:
Plot Line for "Mathmagical 'I'" Episode 1
In the dead of night on a quiet urban street, Marisol, a young Hispanic woman with supernatural abilities, flees from shadowy pursuers led by the menacing Goubert. Using mathematical incantations to enhance her strength and defy gravity, she hides an ancient, powerful tome under a wooden step outside a low-rent apartment building. A tense standoff erupts into a magical battle involving bolts of energy, culminating in a massive explosion that rocks the neighborhood. Young Viola Dowden, an 11-year-old orphan living with her overprotective aunt and uncle, witnesses the chaos from her window but is dismissed when she tries to explain it.
The next morning, the explosion is attributed to a gas main rupture or earthquake, drawing media and cleanup crews. Viola, a habitual counter with undiagnosed gifts, heads to her first day at Taft Middle School with her quirky best friend Aiesha. Eager to blend in after years of frequent moves, Viola navigates school cliques, including cheerleaders, athletes, and the chess club, while developing a crush on skateboarder Dawson Mavis. In homeroom with the charismatic teacher Miss Garcias, introductions highlight student dynamics, and Miss Garcias displays uncanny reflexes.
During math class, Viola suffers a severe headache as numbers on the board swirl chaotically in her vision. While doodling a picture of Marisol casting a fireball, Viola unconsciously solves a "true" mathematical equation, manifesting a real flame that ignites her notebook. Miss Garcias quickly extinguishes it and fabricates a story about a lighter to cover for Viola, escorting her to Principal Jefferson's office. There, the incident is downplayed, and Viola's punishment is after-school cleanup with Miss Garcias.
In science class, Viola confides in Aiesha about the accidental "magic," sparking Aiesha's excitement. School rivalries emerge, with chess whiz Tommy John mocking Viola. After school, Miss Garcias reveals the truth: Viola is a rare "Mathmagician," capable of wielding "True Math" to manipulate reality, a genetic trait that makes her a threat to a hidden society controlling the world. The education system is a facade to identify and suppress such "variables." Miss Garcias, herself a Mathmagician, vows to train Viola in secret to evade "The Ruler," a tyrannical figure.
As Viola leaves school, she spots Goubert arriving as the Superintendent of Schools, recognizing him as the villain from the previous night's battle, leaving her in shock as the episode ends on a cliffhanger.
items.creator: Washington Studios

billingBlock.rawText:
Starring: VIOLA DOWDEN as Viola
Guest Starring: MARISOL as The Mathmagician
Co-Starring: GOUBERT as The Antagonist
Created by: WASHINGTON STUDIOS
Written by: WASHINGTON CREATIVE TEAM
Directed by: WASHINGTON STUDIOS
